AI chip startup Groq has raised $750M at a $6.9B valuation, above expectations for a $600M round at a $6B valuation.

Groq is planning to use the funding to expand its data center capacity, aiming to also open its first APAC location this year. 

$NVDA $AMD $AVGO

Big Tech is pouring hundreds of billions into AI -- possibly the biggest single year commitment the world has ever seen.

io-fund.com/ai-stocks/update‚Ä¶
Microsoft $MSFT signed a 5-year, $6.2 billion deal with Nscale and Aker to rent hyperscale AI capacity in Norway, with deployments commencing in 2026.

Nvidia $NVDA is investing $5 billion in Intel $INTC and collaborating on multiple generations of custom data center and PC chips.

Nvidia says Intel will help make x86 SoCs integrating Nvidia's RTX GPU chiplets for a range of PCs, and Nvidia-custom x86 CPUs for AI platforms.
